page.title: 07FARMING(page1)
page.content: {Mercers Farm}belongs to{Mr.Callow,}he rents all but 5 acres of his land from Laportes and British Industrial Sands.The farm covers 200 acres.He has 40 cows,40 calves and 1 bull.Wheat, barley and hay are also grown.The 50 acre field of grass is cut for silage(pickled grass).Artificial manure is spread by a rotary spreader. A chain harrow is used to take dead grass from the field so new grass can grow.Experiments are being made with human waste which is injected 10 inches into the ground. The farm breeds Hereford, Sussex, Charolais, Jersey and Friesian cattle for meat.Laportes retain rights over use of land for fullers earth purposes. {Warwick Wold}is a group of terraced houses, built for farm labourers, but now modernised for professional people.
